018package org.opengis.test.util;
019
020import java.lang.reflect.Method;
021import java.lang.reflect.Modifier;
022import java.lang.reflect.Type;
023import java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType;
024import java.lang.reflect.InaccessibleObjectException;
025import org.opengis.util.CodeList;
026import org.opengis.test.Validator;
027import org.opengis.test.ValidatorContainer;
028import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.*;
029
030
031/**
032 * Validates {@link CodeList} classes.
033 *
034 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (Geomatys)
035 * @version 3.1
036 * @since   3.1
037 */
038@SuppressWarnings("strictfp")   // Because we still target Java 11.
039public strictfp class CodeListValidator extends Validator {
040    /**
041     * Creates a new validator instance.
042     *
043     * @param container  the set of validators to use for validating other kinds of objects
044     *                   (see {@linkplain #container field javadoc}).
045     */
046    public CodeListValidator(final ValidatorContainer container) {
047        super(container, "org.opengis.util");
048    }
049
050    /**
051     * Ensures that the given code list met the requirements described in the {@link CodeList} class.
052     *
053     * @param  codeType  the code list to validate, or {@code null}.
054     */
055    public void validate(final Class<?> codeType) {
056        if (codeType == null) {
057            return;
058        }
059        /*
060         * Verify class declaration.
061         */
062        assertTrue(Modifier.isFinal(codeType.getModifiers()),
063                () -> classDeclaration(codeType, "Class is not final"));
064        assertEquals(CodeList.class, codeType.getSuperclass(),
065                () -> classDeclaration(codeType, "Class does not extend CodeList directly"));
066        final var type = assertInstanceOf(ParameterizedType.class, codeType.getGenericSuperclass(),
067                () -> classDeclaration(codeType, "Missing parameterized type"));
068        final Type[] atp = type.getActualTypeArguments();
069        assertEquals(1, atp.length,
070                () -> classDeclaration(codeType, "Unexpected number of parameterized types"));
071        assertEquals(codeType, atp[0],
072                () -> classDeclaration(codeType, "The parameterized type shall be the class itself"));
073        /*
074         * Gets the values() method, which should public and static.
075         * Then gets every CodeList instances returned by values().
076         */
077        final CodeList<?>[] values;
078        try {
079            final Method valuesMethod = codeType.getMethod("values", (Class<?>[]) null);
080            final int modifiers = valuesMethod.getModifiers();
081            assertTrue(Modifier.isPublic(modifiers), () -> valuesMethod(codeType, "is not public"));
082            assertTrue(Modifier.isStatic(modifiers), () -> valuesMethod(codeType, "is not static"));
083            values = (CodeList<?>[]) valuesMethod.invoke(null, (Object[]) null);
084            assertNotNull(values, () -> valuesMethod(codeType, "returned null"));
085        } catch (NoSuchMethodException e) {
086            fail(valuesMethod(codeType, "was not found"), e);
087            return;
088        } catch (ReflectiveOperationException | InaccessibleObjectException e) {
089            fail(valuesMethod(codeType, "cannot be read"), e);
090            return;
091        }
092        /*
093         * Get the `valueOf(String)` method and ensure that it returns the same instance for each value.
094         */
095        assertNotEquals(0, values.length, () -> codeType.getSimpleName() + " is empty.");
096        String name = values[0].name();
097        try {
098            final Method valueMethod = codeType.getMethod("valueOf", String.class);
099            for (final CodeList<?> value : values) {
100                name = value.name();
101                assertSame(value, valueMethod.invoke(null, value.name()),
102                        () -> codeType.getSimpleName() + ".valueOf(\"" + value.name()
103                                + "\") did not returned the existing instance.");
104            }
105        } catch (NoSuchMethodException e) {
106            logger.fine(() -> codeType.getSimpleName() + ".valueOf(String) was not found.");
107        } catch (ReflectiveOperationException | InaccessibleObjectException | NullPointerException e) {
108            fail("Cannot invoke " + codeType.getSimpleName() + ".valueOf(\"" + name + "\").", e);
109        }
110    }
111
112    /**
113     * Produces the expected class declaration for a code list.
114     *
115     * @param  codeType  the code list for which to produce a class declaration.
116     * @param  cause     explanation message to insert before the class declaration.
117     * @return error message to return to the user.
118     */
119    private static String classDeclaration(final Class<?> codeType, final String cause) {
120        final String ls = System.lineSeparator();
121        final String className = codeType.getSimpleName();
122        return cause + ". Code list should be declared as below:" + ls
123                + "public final " + className + " extends CodeList<" + className + ">" + ls;
124    }
125
126    private static String valuesMethod(final Class<?> codeType, final String cause) {
127        return codeType.getSimpleName() + ".values() " + cause + '.';
128    }
129}
